_"Our goal with the Women Techmakers Udacity Scholarship is to empower women to advance their technical skills in web and mobile development through enrollment in Nanodegree programs. Our partnership will also include access to a special Women Techmakers/Udacity Slack community, with mentors from within Google."_

<@U4QG3DXBN> No you don't. apply to be a speaker. check out this linkfor additional information <https://alterconf.com/conferences/lagos-nigeria>
<@U4M7USC2X>: Do I have to pay to be a speaker at AlterConf?

Hello guys,

There's a diversity in tech and gaming conference called AlterConf (<https://alterconf.com/>) which is coming up in Lagos on July 1st, 2017.

The PyData Lagos (<https://www.meetup.com/PyData-Lagos/>) group members have been invited to participate in anyway they deem fit. You could submit a talk (<https://alterconf.com/speak>), according to the AlterConf team, you don't need to have speaking experience or be an expert, there's always a first time for everything, AlterConf is going to support you all the way!!

If you don't know what to talk about, you could check out their wishlist (<https://alterconf.com/talk-wishlist>) and pick up any topic you would like to do justice to. There are also archived videos of past speakers (<https://alterconf.com/talks>) for you to gain experience from. Did we also mention AlterConf pays all their speakers and provide them with a free ticket!! :slightly_smiling_face:.

In addition to speaking opportunities, AlterConf also offer opportunities for people to volunteer, become a paid event ambassador, or sign up for paid freelance work taking event photos, writing an event blog post, or sketch noting the event.


Warm Regards,
PyData Lagos
